node.title: 'Australia's most homophobic town' raises pride flag after controversial history
node.alt: The rainbow pride flag flying above town hall and people gather below it.
node.description: A town once the flashpoint for the debate on decriminalising homosexuality in Tasmania raises the rainbow pride flag over its council chambers, marking a change in attitudes after gay locals grew up there and copped abuse daily.
node.content:
["Daniel Howard, who goes by the drag queen name \"Daniel Kitty\", grew up in a place once called \"Australia's most homophobic town\".", "The 24-year-old is from the small coastal township of Ulverstone, on Tasmania's north-west coast, boasting a population of almost 15,000 people.", "Its local council was once the flashpoint for the debate on decriminalising homosexuality in Tasmania, the last state to make the law change, which eventually passed in 1994.", "Ulverstone looks different today, with the\u00a0rainbow flag raised over council chambers this morning, the second Tasmanian council to do so after Hobart, commemorating pride in Tasmania's north-west.", "Daniel \u2014\u00a0who uses the 'they/them' pronouns \u2014\u00a0said when\u00a0they grew up in the area they used to hop off at a bus stop at the same time each day but a man was always waiting for them just outside.", "\"He used to yell out all of this abuse towards me.\u00a0He'd say, 'People like you are ruining this country',\" Daniel said.", "", "
Daniel Howard says they copped abuse daily while growing up in Ulverstone.(Supplied: Daniel Howard)
", "\"I coped my fair share of homophobia from [a] majority of the people because I feel like, at the time, that was a real general mindset.", "Daniel moved to Sydney in 2016 because they felt there was a lack of opportunity for queer people in Tasmania, something they hope is beginning to change.", "\"I think that the flag being erected is something special and life-saving.\u00a0I just wish it happened sooner,\" they said.", "", "
The council once passed a motion opposing the state's decriminalisation of homosexuality.(ABC News: Monte Bovill)
", "\"I think that, if there is a pride flag flying proudly in the town centre\u00a0then it would change the minds and attitudes of a lot of people.", "\"I know there were a lot of families back then that weren't so supportive towards their queer family members.\u00a0I didn't grow up with a very supportive family\u00a0and, so, it was really tough.\"", "
Scene of anti-gay rallies as council opposed decriminalisation
", "The Central Coast Council \u2014\u00a0formerly the Ulverstone Municipal Council \u2014\u00a0made itself known during the decriminalisation debate in the 1980s and 1990s.", "In December 1990, the council carried a motion opposing decriminalisation and urged other councils in the state's north-west to push against reforms, as Ulverstone became the scene of angry anti-gay rallies.", "Equality Tasmania president\u00a0Rodney Croome was protesting outside the anti-gay rallies at the time and said he \"could not have imagined that, in only two decades, Ulverstone would have the rainbow flag flying above its council chambers\".", "\"That's how bad Ulverstone's reputation was in the 1990s and it's what makes it all the more remarkable and wonderful that the council will be flying the rainbow flag.\"", "", "
Equality Tasmania president\u00a0Rodney Croome fought against the anti-gay rallies in the 1980 and 90s and now gets to watch\u00a0the pride flag fly.(ABC News: Monte Bovill)
", "Central Coast's Councillor Amanda Diprose said she was sad about the number of LGBTIQ+ youths that have died on the north-west coast.", "\"There were quite a few young people that [have]\u00a0taken their lives over the time,\" she said.", "\"It has changed, over time, but we still weren't talking about it enough, so it just needed to be put out there and dealt with once and for all.", "\"Especially after the Central Coast Council\u00a0being the municipality for one of the biggest anti-gay rallies that the country had ever seen.\"", "", "
Times have changed for Rodney Croome, who was\u00a0arrested during a pro-gay rights rally.(Supplied: Roger Lovell)
", "In September 2018, Cr Diprose brought forward a motion to the Central Coast Council to help make the region more inclusive, by recognising past homophobia and undertaking to express support through events and initiatives.", "Mr Croome said he would like to see other councils raising the rainbow flag to show their support for equality and inclusion for LGBTIQ+ people.", "\"What's significant about the flag-raising in Ulverstone is not only that it's occurring in what was once called Australia's most homophobic town, but that this is only the second time in Tasmania that the rainbow flag had been raised over a town hall,\" he said, \"the first being in Hobart during the marriage equality debate and, subsequently, every year during the pride festival.", "\"I'm hopeful that Ulverstone will keep raising the rainbow flag to mark important dates for the LGBTIQ+ community and that it will lead other regional municipalities in Tasmania to do the same.\"", "The flag will fly over the council chambers for a week."]
